data.event: Control of New York passed to the English in 1664 and in 1707 Derick Van der Heyden purchased a farm near today's downtown area.
Control of New York passed to the English in 1664 and in 1707 Derick Van der Heyden purchased a farm near today's downtown area.
In 1771 Abraham Lansing had his farm in today's Lansingburgh laid out into lots.

event.title: Lansing's success to the north, in 1787

data.event: Responding to Lansing's success to the north, in 1787, Van der Heyden's grandson Jacob had his extensive holdings surveyed and laid out into lots as well, calling the new village Vanderheyden.
